member.summary: The first one is the DLL path, the rest are aux paths.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Build.Engine.AssemblyUnification.RealizedAssemblyItemUnification
member.summary: Allows to unify assembly files, as realized on disk, by their unique assembly name. This is essential when you're loading runtime assemblies from them, otherwise your runtime types won't match.

member.summary: For assemblies which has been passed thru unification, and for which we know the mapping of the assembly name onto disk, installs an assembly resolver into the current appdomain.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Engine.AssemblyUnification.RealizedAssemblyItemUnification.MasterEnsureReleaseOnShutdown
member.summary: Master shutdown, releases what's come from slave.

member.summary: Reverts assembly realization when its locks are gone, or when the object ends. Has an option to tolerate locked files, e.g. for the Slave mode.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Engine.AssemblyUnification.RealizedAssemblyItemUnification.RealizeAssemblyItem(JetBrains.DataFlow.Lifetime,JetBrains.Metadata.Utils.AssemblyItem)
member.summary: Realizes your assembly item on disk, or extends the lifetime of an already-realized assembly item with the same name and returns its path.
member.param: Will exist at the given path for at least this lifetime. Don't delete yourself, might be shared.
member.returns: Path to the disk file for assembly.

member.summary: Specifies the explicit subfolder name to place the file into. The file name is still taken from the item.

member.summary: Slave mode. Means we load some perdefined

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Engine.AssemblyUnification.RealizedAssemblyItemUnificationEx.RealizeOnAssemblyResolveDemand(JetBrains.Build.Helpers.Metadata.IRealizedAssemblyItemUnification,JetBrains.DataFlow.Lifetime,System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{JetBrains.Metadata.Utils.AssemblyItem})
member.summary: Watch for assembly resolve events, if fired for one of the given assemblies, realize it using the assembly unification and load.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Build.Engine.AssemblyUnification.RealizedAssemblyItemUnificationMaster
member.summary: The master unification manager which can share with a slave instance (e.g. running in another appdomain).

member.name: T:JetBrains.Build.Engine.AssemblyUnification.RealizedAssemblyItemUnificationSlave
member.summary: Loads the realizations already known in some master instance and saved with . Won't be freed by slave instance upon termination. In slave instance, if some realizations were made while running the slave instance, defers their release (and deletion) for the master instance. Example: slave instance running in appdomain, realizing and executing assemblies, can't release them because they're locked by the appdomain, but the master instance can after the appdomain is unloaded.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Build.Engine.IsolatedBuild.BuildEngineNugetServices
member.summary: Nuget operations serving the build engine itself (rather than the user build script in the build process).

member.name: T:JetBrains.Build.Engine.IsolatedBuild.BuildLogRecordMarshaller
member.summary: Accepts log records on any thread, yields them to consumer (e.g. a ListEvents for binding to UI) in the main thread.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Engine.IsolatedBuild.BuildLogRecordMarshaller.Flush
member.summary: MUST be run on the home thread. Flushes the messages still in queue, makes them reach the output func immediately.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Build.Engine.IsolatedBuild.IsolatedBuildGuestCatalog
member.summary: A part of the responsible of making the build part catalog out of what's given as build script sources and binaries.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Build.Engine.IsolatedBuild.IsolatedBuildRunnerEngineNestedBuildRunner
member.summary: The build-engine-injected implementation of the nested build runner.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Engine.IsolatedBuild.CodeDomSourcesCompiler.MakeReferencedAssembliesList(JetBrains.DataFlow.Lifetime,System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{JetBrains.Build.Engine.IsolatedBuild.IsolatedBuildGuestSources.SourceAssemblyReference},JetBrains.Util.CommandLineBuilderJet)
member.summary: Assembly paths, plus aliases for disambiguing the use of the same types.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Build.Engine.IsolatedBuild.IsolatedBuildGuestProxy
member.summary: The proxy assembly for calls from the main to the isolated appdomain, to invoke the Guest run method. Why needed? Can't just call a static or instance method by name directly (no such API), have to load runtime types into the caller appdomain. Doable in C++ because there you can have COM refs in the caller appdomain, but managed code marshals the types into the caller and causes them loaded. Breaks isolation. So we emit an assembly which does not belong to the codebase, so it can be safely loaded into both appdomains without breaking any isolation. And the rest of the data is serialized into a COM stream.

member.name: M:JetBrains.Build.Engine.IsolatedBuild.IsolatedBuildGuestProxy.InvokeGuestRunInAppDomain(System.AppDomain,System.Void*)
member.summary: Invokes the proxy assembly so that it invoked the from the isolated build engine loaded into the isolated appdomain, whichever it is (shipped or from package). The proxy assembly is expected to be already emitted and saved to the basedir of the isolated appdomain, so that it could be loaded on demand. So as the engine assemblies.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Build.Engine.IsolatedBuild.IsolatedBuildGuestSources.EngineAssemblyReferences
member.summary: References to the interface assemblies in Build Engine itself, incl our assemblies and their GAC requirements.

summary.code: #pragma reference assembly Microsoft.Build #pragma reference package Nuget.Core 2.8.3

member.name: F:JetBrains.Build.Engine.IsolatedBuild.IsolatedBuildGuestSources.SourceAssemblyReference.OriginalGacPath
member.summary: For assemblies that we're pulling from GAC, means the path is the primary identity of the assembly, and we're not bringing it along.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Build.Engine.IsolatedBuild.IsolatedBuildGuestSources.SourceAssemblyReference.OriginalImage
member.summary: If the assembly has been originally retrieved to be used as a reference (i.e. not coming from build interface, build script binaries, or GAC, but from an e.g. package reference).
